Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a healthy and growing plant with access to both water and light, clearly depicting vibrant green leaves and standing upright.
The student can accurately draw a plant that is wilting due to lack of water, showing drooping leaves and possibly some yellowing.
The student can accurately draw a plant that is wilting due to lack of light, displaying long, spindly stems and pale or discolored leaves.
The student can effectively show through various drawings that plants need both water and light to live and grow by contrasting healthy and unhealthy plants.
The student can correctly identify and label major parts of the plant, such as roots, stem, leaves, and possibly flowers, in each drawing.
CANNOT: There may be minor gaps, such as inconsistent detail between drawings (e.g., one drawing has more detailed roots, while another has less detail), but overall understanding is strong.
The student might occasionally mislabel a less common part (e.g., using 'stem' instead of 'stalk'), but these are rare and do not significantly impact the overall accuracy.
